Package com.example.midterm_manelespinosa.model.accounts

Class SavingsAccount

java.lang.Object
com.example.midterm_manelespinosa.model.accounts.BasicAccount
com.example.midterm_manelespinosa.model.accounts.SavingsAccount
@Entity public class SavingsAccount extends BasicAccount
Class to create objects of the savings account type. It is a child of the class Basic Account.

      public SavingsAccount(LocalDateTime creationDate, AccountHolder primaryOwner, Money balance, String secretKey, BigDecimal interestRate, Money minimumBalance)
      Constructor for test samples. This constructor only includes primary owner given the second owner is optional. There are two setters to control the entrance of the interest rate attribute and the minimumBalance attribute given that these have some restrictions to fulfill.

    • SavingsAccount

      public SavingsAccount(LocalDateTime creationDate, AccountHolder primaryOwner, AccountHolder secondaryOwner, Money balance, String secretKey, BigDecimal interestRate, Money minimumBalance)
      Constructor for test samples. This is an overloaded constructor given that it includes the second owner. There are two setters to control the entrance of the interest rate attribute and the minimumBalance attribute given that these have some restrictions to fulfill.

      primaryOwner -
      secondaryOwner -

      interestRate -

    • checkIfPenaltyFeeApplicable

      public void checkIfPenaltyFeeApplicable()
      This method checks if the minimum balance is bigger than the current balance to know if the Penalty fee is applicable
      Specified by:
      checkIfPenaltyFeeApplicable in class BasicAccount

    • transactionPossible

      public boolean transactionPossible(BigDecimal quantity)
      THis method computes if the transaction is possible by comparing the balance to the transfer amount.
      Specified by:
      transactionPossible in class BasicAccount
      Parameters:
      quantity - quantity of the transfer
      Returns:
      returns true if the amount is smaller than the balance and false otherwise

    • updateBalance

      public void updateBalance()
      This method updates the account balance by applying the interest rate set previously when checked if more than 364 days have passed since last update. If this condition is true the interest rate is multiplied and added to the balance and the update date is updated.
      Specified by:
      updateBalance in class BasicAccount
